intro: Fosterella atlantica, commonly known as the Atlantic fosterella, is a species of flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Brazil. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding cup. The plant produces striking red or orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils near the coast. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
